gurmukhi: ਭੲੇ ਭਸਮ ਭੂਤ || ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਸਰਬ ਪੂਤ || ਜੁਤ ਸੁਭਟ ਸੈਨ || ਸੁੰਦਰ ਸੁ ਬੈਨ ||੭੪||
transliteration: Bhae Bhasam Bhoot|| Nrip Sarab Poot|| Jout Sabhat Sain|| Soundar Su Bain||74||
translation: All the sons of the king were reduced to ashes and all his forces were destroyed while lamenting.74

gurmukhi: ਸੋਭਾ ਅਪਾਰ || ਸੁੰਦਰ ਕੁਮਾਰ || ਜਬ ਜਰੇ ਸਰਬ || ਤਬ ਤਜਾ ਗਰਬ ||੭੫||
transliteration: Sobhaa Apaar|| Soundar Koumaar|| Jab Dare Sarab|| Tab Tajaa Gadab||75||
translation: When those prices of great glory were burnt down then the pride of all was smashed.75.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਹੂ ਅਜਾਨ || ਸੋਭਾ ਮਹਾਨ || ਦਸ ਚਾਰਵੰਤ || ਸੂਰਾ ਦੁਰੰਤ ||੭੬||
transliteration: Baahoo Ajaan|| Sobhaa Mahaan|| Das Chaarvant|| Sooraa Durant||76||
translation: That most powerful Lord is extremely Glorious and the warriors of all the four directions fear Him.76.

gurmukhi: ਜਰਿ ਭਾਜ ਬੀਰ || ਹੁਅੈ ਚਿਤ ਅਧੀਰ || ਦਿੱਨੋ ਸੰਦੇਸ || ਜਹ ਸਗਰ ਦੇਸ ||੭੭||
transliteration: Jar(i) Bhaaj Beer|| Huai Chit Adheer|| Dinno Sandes|| Jah Sagad Des||77||
translation: Some warriors who had been burnt, ran impatiently towards the king and they conveyed the whole thing to the king sagar.77.

gurmukhi: ਲਹਿ ਸਗਰ ਬੀਰ || ਹ੍ਵੈ ਚਿਤ ਅਧੀਰ || ਪੂਛੇ ਸੰਦੇਸ || ਪੂਤਨ ਸੁ ਬੇਸ ||੭੮||
transliteration: Lah(i) Sagad Beer|| Hvai Chit Adheer|| Poochhe Sandes|| Pootan Su Bes||78||
translation: When the king sagar saw this, he impatiently asked the news about his sons.78.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਜੋਰ ਸਰਬ || ਭਟ ਛੋਰ ਗਰਬ || ੳੁੱਚਰੇ ਬੈਣ || ਜਲ ਚੁਅਤ ਨੈਣ ||੭੯||
transliteration: Kar(i) Jor Sarab|| Bhat Chhodh Gadab|| Ouchchre Bain|| Jal Chuat Nain||79||
translation: Then all of them talked about their strength and also said how the pried of those warriors was destroyed; the tears were flowing from their eyes while saying this.79.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਅ ਫੇਰ ਬਾਜ || ਜਿਣਿ ਸਰਬ ਰਾਜ || ਸਭ ਸੰਗ ਲੀਨ || ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਬਰ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ||੮੦||
transliteration: Bhooa Pher Baaj|| Jin(i) Sarab Raaj|| Sabh San Leen|| Nrip Bar Prabeen||80||
translation: The messengers told this that his sons, causing their horse to move on all the earth, had conquered all the kings and had taken them along with themselves.80.

gurmukhi: ਹਯ ਗਯੋ ਪਯਾਰ || ਤੁਅ ਸੁਤ ੳੁਦਾਰ || ਭੂਅ ਖੋਦ ਸਰਬ || ਅਤਿ ਬਢਾ ਗਰਬ ||੮੧||
transliteration: Haya Gyo Payaar|| Tua Sout Udaar|| Bhaaa Khod Sarab|| At(i) Badhaa Gadab||81||
translation: Your sons, thinking that the horse had gone to the nether-world, had dug the whole of the earth and in this way, their pride had enormously increased.81.

gurmukhi: ਤਹ ਮੁਨਿ ਅਪਾਰ || ਗੁਨ ਗਨ ੳੁਦਾਰ || ਲਖਿ ਮੱਧ ਧਯਾਨ || ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਮਹਾਨ ||੮੨||
transliteration: Tah Mounndi) Apaar|| Goun Gad Udaar Lakh(i) Maddh Dhyaan|| Mounndman Mahaan||82||
translation: There all of them saw themost glorious sage (Kapila) absorbed in meditation.82.

gurmukhi: ਤਵ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਕ੍ਰੋਧ || ਲੇ ਸੰਗਿ ਜੋਧ || ਲੱਤਾਂ ਪ੍ਹਾਰ || ਕੀਅ ਰਿਖ ਅਪਾਰ ||੮੩||
transliteration: Tav Poutra Krodh|| Le San(i) Jodh|| Lattaan Prahaar|| Keea Rikh Apaar||83||
translation: Your sons, taking the warriors with them, hit that sage with their legs.83.

gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਛੁਟਾ ਧਯਾਨ || ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਮਹਾਨ || ਨਿਕਸੀ ਸੁ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ || ਦਾਵਾ ਬਿਸਾਲ ||੮੪||
transliteration: Tab Chhoutaa Dhyaan|| Mounndman Mahaan|| Niksisu Jvaal|| Daavaa Bidaal||84||
translation: Then the meditation of that great sage was shattered and a huge fire came out of his eyes.84.

gurmukhi: ਜਹ ਜਰੇ ਪੂਤ || ਕਹਿ ਅੈਸ ਦੂਤ || ਸੈਨਾ ਸਮੇਤ ਬਾਚਾ ਨ ੲੇਕ ||੮੫||
transliteration: Jah Dare Poot|| Kah(i) Ais Doot|| Sainaa Samet|| Baachaa Na Ek||85||
translation: The messenger told, “O king Sagar ! in this way all your sons were burnt and reduced to ashes alongwith their army and not even one of them survived.”85.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨ ਪੁਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਸ || ਭਯੋ ਪੁਰ ੳੁਦਾਸ || ਜਹ ਤਹ ਸੁ ਲੋਗ || ਬੈਠੇ ਸੁ ਸੋਗ ||੮੬||
transliteration: Soun Poutra Naas|| Bhyo Pur Udaas|| Jag Tah Su Loh|| Baithe Su Sog||86||
translation: Hearing about the destruction of his sons, the whole city was steeped in sorrow and all the people here and there were filled with anguish.86.

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਿਵ ਸਿਮਰ ਬੈਨ || ਜਲ ਥਾਮ ਨੈਨ || ਕਰਿ ਧੀਰਜ ਚਿੱਤ || ਮੁਨ ਮਨ ਪਵਿੱਤ ||੮੭||
transliteration: Shiv Dimar Bain|| Jal Thaam Nain|| Kar(i) Dheeraj Chitt|| Mounndman Pavitt||87||
translation: All of them, remembering Shiva, withholding their tears assumed patience in their minds with the holy saying of the sages.87.
